column2: Transport motor malfunction
Transport motor (M1) Printer control board (PRCB) DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Check the M1 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check M1 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 M1 operation check. PRCB PJ8-1 to 6 C-2 5 Change PRCB. 6 Change DCPU. .
Rack rotation failure
Rack motor (M2) Rack positioning sensor (PS5) Printer control board (PRCB)

1 Check the M2 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check M2 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 PS5 sensor check. PRCB PJ5-11 (ON) C-11 to 12 5 M2 operation check. PRCB PJ5-5 to 8 C-12 6 Change PRCB.
Ozone ventilation fan motor malfunction
Ozone ventilation fan motor (FM2) Printer control board (PRCB)

1 Check the FM2 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 FM2 operation check. PRCB PJ16-1 (REM) PRCB PJ16-3 (LOCK) C-4 5 Change FM2. 6 Change PRCB.
Power supply cooling fan motor malfunction
DC power supply fan motor (FM1) Printer control board (PRCB) DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Check the FM1 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 FM1 operation check. HV CN2-1 (REM) HV CN2-3 (LOCK) B-5 5 Change PRCB. 6 Change DCPU.
Transfer belt rotation failure
Belt positioning sensor (PS6) Photoconductor unit Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 PS6 sensor check. 3 Change Photoconductor unit. 4 Change PRCB.
2nd image transfer pressure/retraction failure
2nd image transfer retraction position sensor (PS3) 2nd image transfer pressure/retraction solenoid (SD4) Transport motor (M1) Printer control board (PRCB)

1 Check the M1 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check M1 for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the SD4 connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 5 PS3 sensor check. PRCB PJ12-3 (ON) C-2 to 3 6 SD4 operation check. PRCB PJ10-6 (REM) C-9 7 M1 operation check. PRCB PJ8-1 to 6 C-2 8 Change PRCB.
Polygon motor malfunction
PH unit Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PH unit. 3 Change PRCB.
Laser malfunction
PH Unit Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PH unit. 3 Change PRCB.
Fuser warm-up failure
Fuser unit Printer control board (PRCB) DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Change fuser unit. 2 1. Main switch is turned ON. 2. Open the top cover. 3. Press the following keys in this order. Clear key Rotate Toner key Clear key Rotate Toner key. 4. Main switch is turned OFF/ON. 3 Change PRCB. 4 Change DCPU.
Thermistor open-circuit failure
Fuser unit Printer control board (PRCB) DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the fuser unit, DCPU, and PRCB for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change fuser unit. 4 Change PRCB. 5 Change DCPU.
Thermistor resistance failure
Fuser unit Printer control board (PRCB) DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Change fuser unit. 2 1. Main switch is turned ON. 2. Open the top cover. 3. Press the following keys in this order. Clear key Rotate Toner key Clear key Rotate Toner key. 4. Main switch is turned OFF/ON. 3 Change PRCB. 4 Change DCPU.
Abnormally low fuser temperature
Fuser unit Printer control board (PRCB) DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the fuser unit, DCPU, and PRCB for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change fuser unit. 4 Change PRCB. 5 Change DCPU.
Abnormally high fuser temperature
Fuser unit Printer control board (PRCB) DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Check the fuser unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the fuser unit, DCPU, and PRCB for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Change fuser unit. 4 Change PRCB. 5 Change DCPU.
Waste toner full sensor trouble
Waste toner full sensor (PS7) Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 PS7 sensor check. 3 Change PRCB.
Printer control board malfunction
Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the PRCB connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PRCB.
13DD
Backup data error
Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Confirm mounting status of EEPROM on the printer control board, and make modification if necessary. 2 Change PRCB.
Flash ROM write error
Printer control board (PRCB) MFP board (MFPB)
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PRCB. 3 Change MFPB.
Engine control failure
Printer control board (PRCB) MFP board (MFPB)
1 Check the cable and connector for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Change PRCB. 3 Change MFPB.
